channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Meta to test premium subscriptions on Instagram, Facebook, and WhatsApp
item.description: In the coming months, Meta is going to explore a premium experience on Instagram, Facebook, and WhatsApp that gives users access to special features and more control over how they share and connect, while keeping the core experiences free.

item.title: Want a free Apple Watch SE 3? Optus is throwing one in with any iPhone 17 series sign up
item.description: If you’re looking to upgrade to the newest iPhones and you also want a new smartwatch, this deal from Optus is the phone plan you’re looking for.

item.title: Wait, So When *Is* ‘Starfleet Academy’ Set, Anyway?
item.description: We know the new 'Star Trek' show is set in the 32nd century, but lining it up with 'Discovery' requires a Trekkie-amount of overthinking.

item.title: Code Vein 2 is everything I could’ve wanted from a sequel as a fan of the original game — except its dismal console performance
item.description: In spite of some spotty performance on console, Code Vein 2 is a triumphant sequel that fans of the original are likely to love.

item.title: Skyscraper Live proves that Netflix is still figuring out its live events – here’s why viewers couldn’t get past its 'insufferable' commentary
item.description: Viewers who tuned into Netflix's Skyscraper Live were baffled by the show's unnecessary commentary and over-produced façade.

item.title: Automakers Could Take A Big Hit Because Of An AI-Induced Chip Shortage
item.description: Is AI proliferation making your next car suck?

item.title: Some international attendees are skipping 2026 GDC due to safety fears and growing ICE presence
item.description: Many members of the international games industry are skipping the 2026 Game Developers Conference because of the growing ICE presence and other concerns.

item.title: X faces EU investigation over Grok’s sexualized deepfakes
item.description: X is facing an investigation from the European Commission over the sexualized deepfakes generated by its Grok AI chatbot. In its announcement, the Commission says it will evaluate whether X "properly assessed and mitigated risks" associated with Grok's image-generating capabilities in the EU, as reported earlier by The New York Times. Advocacy groups and lawmakers […]...

item.title: Chinese storage startup uses ancient, controversial technique to deliver 'extraordinarily fast and resilient' SSD: this weirdly-named Roealsen6 unlocks hardware compression to deliver incredible PCIe SSD speeds
item.description: Chinese PCIe Gen5 SSD uses hardware compression to reach record benchmark speeds, although performance depends on how well the data compresses.

item.title: Judge Delays Minnesota ICE Decision While Weighing Whether State Was Being Illegally Punished
item.description: A federal judge ordered a new briefing due Wednesday on whether DHS is using armed raids to pressure Minnesota into abandoning its sanctuary policies, leaving ICE operations in place for now.

item.title: These 7 hidden iOS features have transformed how I use my iPhone
item.description: Whether you want to block out the world, hide your apps, or just get things done faster, these tools should help.

item.title: Google agrees to $68 million settlement in voice assistant privacy lawsuit
item.description: Google has agreed to a $68 million settlement regarding claims that its voice assistant inappropriately spied on smartphone users. Plaintiffs claimed that the company’s Google Assistant platform began listening to them after it misheard conversations that sounded like its wake words. The suit argued that private information that Google Assistant shouldn't have heard was then used to deliver those individuals targeted ads. Reuters reported that Google denied wrongdoing in the suit, but according to court papers, the company agreed to a settlement in order to avoid the risk and costs of litigati...

item.title: Anthropic CEO Worries Humanity May Not be ‘Mature’ Enough for Advanced AI
item.description: When has that ever stopped us?

item.title: Palantir Defends Work With ICE to Staff Following Killing of Alex Pretti
item.description: “In my opinion ICE are the bad guys. I am not proud that the company I enjoy so much working for is part of this,” one worker wrote on Slack.

item.title: Rian Johnson Shares His Preferred Vision for the Future of ‘Star Wars’
item.description: 'The Last Jedi' director thinks the galaxy far, far away should pass to a new generation.

item.title: A coin-op gaming PC — and one that can cloak its hardware innards — here are 3 of the weirdest, coolest new PC cases
item.description: A DIY project for a PC that's turned on by inserting a coin, and a case that can go from opaque to transparent at the touch of a button.

item.title: Where does Google’s AI get its health advice? A study points to YouTube
item.description: A study of 50,000+ health searches found Google’s AI Overviews cited YouTube more than any hospital, clinic, or health agency. Every month, around two billion people see AI Overviews, Google’s AI-powered search feature that generates summaries to users’ queries. Now, a new study is revealing a concerning pattern among some of these responses: When asked health-related questions, AI Overviews appears to turn to YouTube significantly more often than trusted medical sites....

item.title: TikTok’s New US Owners Are Off to a Very Rocky Start
item.description: Thousands of American TikTok users have reported having issues with the app this past weekend.

item.title: How to watch Extracted season 2 online from anywhere
item.description: Want to watch Extracted season 2 online from anywhere? Stream every desperate fight and decision for food, shelter, and survival in the wild.

item.title: TikTok Data Center Outage Triggers Trust Crisis for New US Owners
item.description: The technical failure coincided with TikTok’s ownership transition, leading users to question whether videos criticizing ICE raids in Minnesota were being intentionally censored.

item.title: Vinod Khosla publicly disavows Keith Rabois’ comments on ICE shooting
item.description: Unwavering Trump loyalist and VC Keith Rabois caused his colleague and his firm's founder to distance themselves from his comments on ICE.

item.title: Nordic Equestrian Project Asks Horses if They Want Blankets or Not
item.description: Researchers have taught horses to communicate their preferences with symbols.

item.title: How to watch American Idol 2026 online from anywhere
item.description: Format changes bring fresh voting, new rounds, and Monday premieres. Here’s how you can watch American Idol 2026 online and from anywhere.

item.title: YouTubers sue Snap for alleged copyright infringement in training its AI models
item.description: The YouTubers claim Snap, like others, used AI datasets meant for research and academic use to train its AI models.

item.title: Tim Cook Attends White House Screening of ‘Melania’ Movie, Prompts Calls for Apple Boycott
item.description: The Apple CEO doesn't seem shy about getting cozy with the Trump regime.

item.title: '.ai' websites are booming - and making millions for this tiny Caribbean nation
item.description: Google, x.ai, Perplexity and other AI startups are all helping to fund critical infrastructure upgrades in Anguilla.

item.title: Minnesota CEOs’ call for ‘de-escalation’ isn’t enough. Here’s why.
item.description: Target, Best Buy, 3M and General Mills and other huge firms’ top bosses finally broke their silence in a not-so-strongly worded letter about ICE. Experts say they missed the mark. CEOs of Minnesota’s biggest companies signed a public letter calling for “immediate de-escalation of tensions” after weeks of silence following Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) descending upon the state, which has led to civilian deaths, abductions, economic stand-stills and a profound disruption of daily life....
